intro: Psychotria vellerea, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria vellerea is also known for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
